title: See and feel the kiln culture in SE China
content:
Photo taken on Nov. 8, 2019 shows the details of a Jianzhan teaware in Jianyang District of Nanping City, southeast China's Fujian Province. (Xinhua/Li Peng)
JIANYANG, Nov. 10, 2019 (Xinhua) -- Jianzhan teaware, well-known Chinese porcelain originated in Jianyang, dates back 1,000 years. 
Recently, local government has been developing the brand of Jian Kiln Jianzhan through promoting "craftsman spirit" and renovating techniques. The annual output value of the Jianzhan industry in Jianyang reached 1.65 billion yuan (about 236 million U.S. dollars) in 2018. Over 20,000 employees work in the Jianzhan industry so far.
